asset_relationship.description: Represents a generic relationship between two assets.
asset_relationship.example: Creating lineage between a source table and a target table.

data_flow.description: Represents a data flow relationship between two assets.
data_flow.example: Capturing the data flow from a source database to a target data lake.

data_transformation.description: Represents a data transformation relationship between two assets.
data_transformation.example: Tracking the transformation process between a source dataset and a transformed dataset.

data_owner.description: Represents the ownership relationship of data assets.
data_owner.example: Establishing the ownership of a data asset by assigning a data owner.

data_consumer.description: Represents the consumption relationship of data assets.
data_consumer.example: Identifying the consumers of a specific data asset.

data_supplier.description: Represents the supply relationship of data assets.
data_supplier.example: Establishing the data suppliers for a specific data asset.

data_source.description: Represents the source relationship of data assets.
data_source.example: Indicating the source of data for a particular asset.

data_target.description: Represents the target relationship of data assets.
data_target.example: Indicating the target location where data is being sent.

source_type.description: The type of the source asset.

source_name.description: The name of the source asset.

target_type.description: The type of the target asset.

target_name.description: The name of the target asset.

transformation_type.description: The type of data transformation performed.

transformation_details.example: Join customer_table with orders_table on customer_id
